'''Calenardhon''' was a green region north of the [[White Mountains]], which became a province of [[Gondor]] and later became known as [[Rohan]].

==History==
In {{SA|882}},<ref>{{UT|4a}}, ''Chronology''</ref> [[Gil-galad]], the king of the [[Elves|elven]] realm of [[Lindon]] and [[High King of the Noldor]] in [[Middle-earth]] warned [[Tar-Meneldur]], the [[King of Númenor]] in a letter that a servant of [[Morgoth]] was arising in the East and that he thought that he would invade the Westlands from the East through the gap between the southern end of the [[Misty Mountains]] and the White Mountains in Calenardhon, that they at least had to defend Eriador along the long rivers west of the Misty Mountains and asked Tar-Meneldur for men to help to strengthen the haven of [[Vinyalondë]] so that it could accomodate the great ships of the [[Númenóreans]].<ref>{{UT|Wife}}</ref>

In {{SA|1695}}, this servant, [[Sauron]] came with a great army through Calenardhon and invaded Eriador in the [[War of the Elves and Sauron]]. When Sauron's army was utterly defeated in the [[Battle of the Gwathló]] with the help of a Númenorean army which had landed at the haven of Vinyalondë at the mouth of the river [[Gwathló]] Sauron only narrowly escaped with a small force, but he was again attacked in the east of Calenardhon and fled back with only a bodyguard of troops to [[Mordor]].<ref>{{UT|Concerning}}</ref>

In {{TA|1437}},<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 1347, p. 1086</ref> during the [[Kin-strife]] when [[Eldacar]], the deposed [[King of Gondor]] returned to Gondor from his refuge in [[Wilderland]] with a great army of [[Northmen]] who had served Gondor and of [[Dúnedain]] of the northern parts of Gondor, folk from the province of Calenardhon gathered to him.<ref>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for King Valacar, p. 1047</ref>

From {{TA|1636}} to {{TA|1637|n}} during the [[Great Plague]] the people of Calenhardhon suffered like all the peoples of the rest of Gondor and [[Arnor]].<ref>{{UT|11c}}, first paragraph of the long note</ref>

From {{TA|2063}} to {{TA|2460|n}} the population of Calenardhon declined when a part of it moved to the east to hold the line of the river [[Anduin]]. The Gondorian garrisons of the fortresses of [[Hornburg|Aglarond]] and [[Isengard|Angrenost]] were not renewed and the forts were left in the care of local hereditary chieftains. The subjects of those chieftains became more mixed in blood, because the [[Dunlendings]] were not hindered to migrate over the river [[Isen]] into Calenardhon.<ref>{{UT|11c}}, first and second paragraph of the long note</ref>

During the rule of the [[Steward of Gondor|Steward]] [[Cirion]], [[Gondor]] was attacked by the [[Balchoth]] and by Orcs from the Misty Mountains, and Calenardhon was overrun by these invaders. Cirion sent messages for help to Gondor's old allies, the [[Éothéod]], to help defend Gondor.<ref name=stewards>{{App|Stewards}}</ref>

[[Eorl the Young]] answered the call, and helped Gondor defeat the Balchoth and the Orcs at the [[Field of Celebrant]]. In gratitude, Cirion granted all Calenardhon to the Éothéod.<ref name=stewards/>

After the Éothéod settled in Calenardhon, the land was called [[Rohan]] in Gondor<ref>{{TT|Window}}, p. 678</ref><ref>{{UT|Eorl}}</ref> and the Mark of the Riders,<ref>{{App|Eorl}}, fourth paragraph, p. 1064</ref> the [[Mark]]<ref>{{UT|Index}}, entry ''Mark''</ref> or the [[Riddermark]] by the Éothéod.<ref>{{App|Men}}, p. 1129</ref><ref>{{TT|King}}, p. 508</ref><ref>{{RK|Houses}}, p. 868</ref><ref>{{TT|Riders}}, p. 432</ref>

==Etymology==
{{Pronounce|Calenardhon.mp3|Ardamir}}
'''''Calenardhon''''' is a [[Sindarin]] name,<ref name=Eldamo>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2641131487.html|articlename=S. ''Calenardhon'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=20 February 2024}}</ref><ref name=GS>{{HM|GS}}, entry '''Calenardhon''', p. 371</ref> which means "green province"<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Calenardhon'', p. 477</ref><ref>{{UT|Index}}, entry ''Calenardhon''</ref> or "the (great) green region".<ref>{{L|297}}</ref> The initial element is clearly ''[[calen]]'' ("green"),<ref name=Eldamo/><ref name=GS/> the second element is probably ''[[gardh]]'' ("region")<ref name=Eldamo/><ref name=GS/> and the final element is the suffix ''[[-nd|on(d)]]'' ("region").<ref name=Eldamo/><ref name=GS/><ref>{{UT|8e}}, note 49, p. 318</ref>

Earlier names used by Tolkien for this region were ''[[Elenarda (disambiguation)|Elenarda]]'' > ''Kalen(arda)'' > ''Kalinarda'' > ''Calenardan'' >  ''Calenardon''.<ref>{{WR|2|V}}</ref><ref>{{PM|VII}}</ref>
